questions.text: The distance of the point P(-6, 8) from the origin is:
The mid-point of the line segment joining the points (-3, 9) and (-6, -4) is:
The point on the x-axis which is equidistant from (2, -5) and (-2, 9) is:
questions.explanation: Let P(x,0). PA² = PB². (x-2)² + 25 = (x+2)² + 81. Solve for x.

questions.text: If (a/3, 4) is the midpoint of the line segment joining the points A(-6, 5) and B(-2, 3), then the value of 'a' is:
The distance between the points A(0, 6) and B(0, -2) is:
Which point lies on the x-axis?
The distance of point P(2, 3) from the x-axis is:
questions.explanation: Distance from x-axis is the y-coordinate (absolute value).

questions.text:
Assertion (A): The point (0, 4) lies on y-axis.
Reason (R): The x-coordinate of a point on y-axis is zero.
options: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation
Both true but R not explanation
questions.answer: (a) Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation

questions.text:
Assertion (A): The point (-1, 6) divides the line segment joining (-3, 10) and (6, -8) in the ratio 2:7.
Reason (R): Three points A, B, C are collinear if AB + BC = AC.
options: Both A and R are true
Both A and R true but R not explanation
questions.answer: (b) Both true but R is not the explanation (Explanation needs section formula).

questions.text:
Assertion (A): Mid-point of a line segment divides line in the ratio 1:1.
Reason (R): The ratio in which the point (-3, k) divides the line segment joining (-5, 4) and (-2, 3) is 1:2.
options: Both A and R are true

questions.text: Find the values of y for which the distance between the points P(2, -3) and Q(10, y) is 10 units.
Find the point on the y-axis which is equidistant from the points (5, -2) and (-3, 2).
Find the ratio in which the line segment joining the points (-3, 10) and (6, -8) is divided by (-1, 6).
Check whether (5, -2), (6, 4) and (7, -2) are the vertices of an isosceles triangle.
Find a relation between x and y such that the point (x, y) is equidistant from the points (7, 1) and (3, 5).
If the point C(k, 4) divides the line segment joining points A(2, 6) and B(5, 1) in ratio 2:3, find the value of k.
Find the coordinates of a point A, where AB is the diameter of a circle whose centre is (2, -3) and B is (1, 4).
Find the distance of the point P(2, 3) from the x-axis.
Find the coordinates of the points of trisection of the line segment joining (4, -1) and (-2, -3).
If the point C(-1, 2) divides internally the line segment joining A(2, 5) and B(x, y) in the ratio 3:4, find the coordinates of B.
Find the ratio in which the y-axis divides the line segment joining the points (5, -6) and (-1, -4). Also find the point of intersection.
If (1, 2), (4, y), (x, 6) and (3, 5) are the vertices of a parallelogram taken in order, find x and y.
Find the area of a rhombus if its vertices are (3, 0), (4, 5), (-1, 4) and (-2, -1) taken in order.
Show that the points (1, 7), (4, 2), (-1, -1) and (-4, 4) are the vertices of a square.

Case Study: Classroom Seating.
In a classroom, 4 friends are seated at points A, B, C and D. Champa and Chameli observe their positions. (Coordinates given in graph).
(i) Find distance between A and B.
(ii) Find distance AC.
(iii) Check if ABCD is a square.

Case Study: Gardening.
Students of a school are standing in rows and columns in their playground for a drill practice. A, B, C, D are the positions of four students.
(i) Find the coordinates of A and B.
(ii) Find the distance between A and C.
(iii) Find the mid-point of the segment AC.

Case Study: Jagdish's Field.
Jagdish has a field which is in the shape of a right angled triangle AQC. He wants to leave a space in the form of a square PQRS inside the field for growing vegetables.
(i) Taking O as origin, find coordinates of P.
(ii) What is the area of square PQRS?
Find the ratio in which the line segment joining A(1, -5) and B(-4, 5) is divided by the x-axis. Also find the coordinates of the point of division.
Name the type of quadrilateral formed, if any, by the following points, and give reasons for your answer: (-1, -2), (1, 0), (-1, 2), (-3, 0).
The three vertices of a parallelogram ABCD are A(3, -4), B(-1, -3) and C(-6, 2). Find the coordinates of vertex D.
Find the centre of a circle passing through the points (6, -6), (3, -7) and (3, 3).
